timeline.bodyText:
It seems to me we should at least run LuceneQuery.escapeQuery() on these parameters. But is there a way we could do this more cleanly, i.e., by passing these as paramters instead of a string replace operation?
If not, we should at least have this query stored as a constant string since we really just need to do some replacements right before it's executed.
timeline.author: ibacher

replies.bodyText:
What I could do is to directly replace in the query definition the n1, n2, n3 parameter with the correct value but this would made the code less readable I guess.
I think I would prefer to make it a constant and then replacing the values.
Can you elaborate a bit more on what your thoughts are on "passing these as parameters"?
Anyways, the escapeQuery can be added easily. I will probably do that till next Sunday!
Thanks!

timeline.bodyText:
Some comments on this function now:

We seem to have eliminated the need for the result variable at all, so that should probably be removed.
The line StringBuilder q = ... should be moved to the final else block, since that's the only place it's necessary.
Either the final else block should be removed or everything after the end of the final else block should be added into the final else block as that common logic only applies when we continue to support a case for multiple names.
